title: Maarten van der Heijden's website
author: Maarten van der Heijden
description: This is my personal website where you can find links and information about myself

PHP.comments: My first 'real' programming language. Through PHP I learned about XML, INI files and JSON and other programming concepts. I also greatly enjoy PHP 7 with all its strict typing.

Symfony.comments: The PHP framework I picked up during my internship, it has become my go-to framework for PHP apps. I especially love the Doctrine ORM and the dependency injection component.

C#/.NET Core.comments: A language a picked up at school and during my the Continuous Delivery minor at InfoSupport. I love the amount of shortcuts the language has and the OOP nature of it. I've also written a RabbitMQ C# framework during my minor.

RabbitMQ.comments: I've used this message broker software at school and during my minor, I even wrote a C# framework for it: https://github.com/survivorbat/rabbitmq-miffy-wrapper

Linux.comments: I was introduced to Ubuntu by a classmate and since then I've moved completely from Windows to either Ubuntu or Linux Mint. I've also worked with Ubuntu and Debian servers to run applications both for personal use and for work.

Azure DevOps.comments: A development environment I greatly enjoy, my public project code is still on Github but all my pipelines are housed in AzDo

Javascript.comments: When I discovered that I could make websites dynamic using JS I suddenly saw the light, since then most of my websites either use AJAX requests or utilise a frontend framework.

Relational Databases.comments: My favourite type of database, I usually utilise ORM frameworks to migrate databases for me but for a long time I've done it through simple SQL queries.

NoSQL Databases.comments: In school we had several projects involving NoSQL projects like Neo4J, Redis and MongoDB

HTML/CSS.comments: My first websites were bare-bones HTML and CSS, nowadays I use templating engines or JSX in ReactJS
